poem:
### Wild Cherry

Sharpened whispers, halls of gloss,  
young girls draped in scarlet secrets.  
Grace and Allegra, rebellion's flight,  
glittering talons tucked inside cuffed sleeves.  
Mothers summoned, faces pinched as paper,  
truth unfolds, a petal, bruised, yet bold —  
roses bloom in blood-soaked privilege,  
a private dance under watchful eyes.
